EXHIBITIONS

The Glasgow School of Art offers a continuous 12-month programme of exhibitions across four galleries on campus. The programme is designed to appeal to both our collegiate community at GSA as well as the public both in Scotland and beyond. Admission is free.

As well as a wide range of international exhibitions featuring contemporary artists, designers and architects, the programme presents the work of undergraduates, postgraduates and staff and hosts regular exhibitions focussing on historical perspectives within visual art. Through the exhibitions programme, the GSA is able to foster links with local and international institutions, and organisations such as the Goethe Institut, the Japan Foundation and the Royal Academy.

Students participate in an annual exhibition of their departmental work-in-progress and are further offered the opportunity of exhibiting in two galleries within the Student Union. The exhibition programme also incorporates a continuing programme of accompanying events, including seminars, workshops and gallery/artist talks.

The reputation of The Glasgow School of Art as an institution, together with its location within Charles Rennie Mackintosh's landmark building and the diverse and significant gallery programme, attracts a large national and international audience. With support from the City of Glasgow, the Scottish Arts Council and other sponsors, the exhibition programme makes a significant contribution to the cultural life of the city and represents both the School and the City of Glasgow internationally.

Recent exhibitions have included

  • Japanese painter Satoshi Watanabe
  • Italian designer Ettore Sotsass
  • Scottish painter Ken Currie
  • English textile designer Lucienne Day
  • Australian jewellery designer Susan Cohn
  • Japanese sculptor Susumu Shingu
